channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Witkoff and Kushner Expected to Join Israel-Hamas Talks

item.title: Democrats take legal aim at "the Radical Left" language during shutdown
item.description: Democrats and a federal union argue the Trump administration's language posted on federal agency websites and in some emails blaming the 'Radical Left...

item.title: The government shutdown is snarling air travel. Officials say it could get worse

item.title: The costs of Israel's longest war, for Israelis
item.description: Israelis are paying heavy costs for the longest war in their history: a mental health crisis, trauma, unprecedented division during wartime, animosity...

item.title: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
item.description: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not ...

item.title: These numbers show how 2 years of war have devastated Palestinian lives in Gaza
item.description: It's been two years since Hamas-led militants attacked Israel, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages. In response, Israeli leaders promise...

item.title: Trump to Unveil Farmer Aid as China Shuns U.S. Crops
item.description: As it did in 2018, the White House plans to dole out relief funds to struggling U.S. farmers who have lost their biggest customer.

item.title: Mass Layoffs Trump Is Threatening in Shutdown Fight May Be Illegal
item.description: Unions have sued to block any firings, which budget experts believe are not even needed to protect essential federal services.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded for Work in Quantum Mechanics
item.description: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis were recognized for work that made behaviors of the subatomic realm observable at a larger scale.

item.title: An Ideological Revolution Needs 12 Years in Power
item.description: The Trump administration has a long way to go.

item.title: Ask a Correspondent, With Our Chief White House Reporter
item.description: Peter Baker answers questions from readers about covering President Trump and the changing U.S. role in the world.

item.title: What People in Gaza Told Us About Two Years of War

item.title: With Sébastien Lecornu’s Resignation, France Faces Increasing Turmoil
item.description: The record-fast collapse of yet another government confronts President Emmanuel Macron and his country with an intensifying crisis.
